list.title: Audio
list.description:
LittleJS Audio System

  • ZzFX Sound Effects - ZzFX Sound Effect Generator
  • ZzFXM Music - ZzFXM Music System
  • Caches sounds and music for fast playback
  • Can attenuate and apply stereo panning to sounds
  • Ability to play mp3, ogg, and wave files
  • Speech synthesis functions

list.title: Draw
list.description:
LittleJS Drawing System

  • Hybrid system with both Canvas2D and WebGL available
  • Super fast tile sheet rendering with WebGL
  • Can apply rotation, mirror, color and additive color
  • Font rendering system with built in engine font
  • Many useful utility functions

LittleJS uses a hybrid rendering solution with the best of both Canvas2D and WebGL. There are 3 canvas/contexts available to draw to... mainCanvas - 2D background canvas, non WebGL stuff like tile layers are drawn here. glCanvas - Used by the accelerated WebGL batch rendering system. overlayCanvas - Another 2D canvas that appears on top of the other 2 canvases.

The WebGL rendering system is very fast with some caveats...

  • Switching blend modes (additive) or textures causes another draw call which is expensive in excess
  • Group additive rendering together using renderOrder to mitigate this issue

The LittleJS rendering solution is intentionally simple, feel free to adjust it for your needs!

list.description: Draw directly to a 2d canvas context in world space

list.title: Engine
list.description:
LittleJS - The Tiny JavaScript Game Engine That Can! MIT License - Copyright 2021 Frank Force

Engine Features

  • Object oriented system with base class engine object
  • Base class object handles update, physics, collision, rendering, etc
  • Engine helper classes and functions like Vector2, Color, and Timer
  • Super fast rendering system for tile sheets
  • Sound effects audio with zzfx and music with zzfxm
  • Input processing system with gamepad and touchscreen support
  • Tile layer rendering and collision system
  • Particle effect system
  • Medal system tracks and displays achievements
  • Debug tools and debug rendering system
  • Post processing effects
  • Call engineInit() to start it up!

list.title: TileCollision
list.description:
LittleJS Tile Layer System

  • Caches arrays of tiles to off screen canvas for fast rendering
  • Unlimted numbers of layers, allocates canvases as needed
  • Interfaces with EngineObject for collision
  • Collision layer is separate from visible layers
  • It is recommended to have a visible layer that matches the collision
  • Tile layers can be drawn to using their context with canvas2d
  • Drawn directly to the main canvas without using WebGL

list.title: TileCollision.getTileCollisionData
list.description: Get tile collision data

list.title: TileCollision.initTileCollision
list.description: Clear and initialize tile collision

list.title: TileCollision.setTileCollisionData
list.description: Set tile collision data

list.title: TileCollision.tileCollision
list.description: The tile collision layer array, use setTileCollisionData and getTileCollisionData to access

list.title: TileCollision.tileCollisionRaycast
list.description: Return the center of tile if any that is hit (does not return the exact intersection)

list.title: TileCollision.tileCollisionSize
list.description: Size of the tile collision layer

list.title: TileCollision.tileCollisionTest
list.description: Check if collision with another object should occur

Draw all the tile data to an offscreen canvas

  • This may be slow in some browsers but only needs to be done once

list.title: TileLayer#redrawStart
list.description:
Call to start the redraw process

  • This can be used to manually update small parts of the level

list.title: Utilities
list.description:
LittleJS Utility Classes and Functions

  • General purpose math library
  • Vector2 - fast, simple, easy 2D vector class
  • Color - holds a rgba color with some math functions
  • Timer - tracks time automatically
  • RandomGenerator - seeded random number generator

list.title: Utilities.PI
list.description: A shortcut to get Math.PI

list.title: Utilities.abs
list.description: Returns absoulte value of value passed in

list.title: Utilities.clamp
list.description: Clamps the value beween max and min

list.title: Utilities.distanceAngle
list.description: Returns signed wrapped distance between the two angles passed in

list.title: Utilities.distanceWrap
list.description: Returns signed wrapped distance between the two values passed in

list.title: Utilities.formatTime
list.description: Formats seconds to mm:ss style for display purposes

list.title: Utilities.hsl
list.description: Create a color object with HSLA values, white by default

list.title: Utilities.isColor
list.description: Check if object is a valid Color

list.title: Utilities.isOverlapping
list.description: Returns true if two axis aligned bounding boxes are overlapping

list.title: Utilities.isVector2
list.description: Check if object is a valid Vector2

list.title: Utilities.lerp
list.description: Linearly interpolates between values passed in using percent

list.title: Utilities.lerpAngle
list.description: Linearly interpolates between the angles passed in with wrappping

list.title: Utilities.lerpWrap
list.description: Linearly interpolates between values passed in with wrappping

list.title: Utilities.max
list.description: Returns highest of two values passed in

list.title: Utilities.min
list.description: Returns lowest of two values passed in

list.title: Utilities.mod
list.description: Returns first parm modulo the second param, but adjusted so negative numbers work as expected

list.title: Utilities.nearestPowerOfTwo
list.description: Returns the nearest power of two not less then the value

list.title: Utilities.percent
list.description: Returns what percentage the value is between valueA and valueB

list.title: Utilities.rgb
list.description: Create a color object with RGBA values, white by default

list.title: Utilities.sign
list.description: Returns the sign of value passed in (also returns 1 if 0)

list.title: Utilities.smoothStep
list.description: Applies smoothstep function to the percentage value

list.title: Utilities.vec2
list.description: Create a 2d vector, can take another Vector2 to copy, 2 scalars, or 1 scalar

list.title: Utilities.wave
list.description: Returns an oscillating wave between 0 and amplitude with frequency of 1 Hz by default

list.title: Vector2
list.description: Create a 2D vector with the x and y passed in, can also be created with vec2()

list.title: Vector2#add
list.description: Returns a copy of this vector plus the vector passed in

list.title: Vector2#angle
list.description: Returns the angle of this vector, up is angle 0

list.title: Vector2#area
list.description: Returns the area this vector covers as a rectangle

list.title: Vector2#arrayCheck
list.description: Returns true if this vector is within the bounds of an array size passed in

list.title: Vector2#clampLength
list.description: Returns a new vector clamped to length passed in

list.title: Vector2#copy
list.description: Returns a new vector that is a copy of this

list.title: Vector2#cross
list.description: Returns the cross product of this and the vector passed in

list.title: Vector2#direction
list.description: Returns the integer direction of this vector, corrosponding to multiples of 90 degree rotation (0-3)

list.title: Vector2#distance
list.description: Returns the distance from this vector to vector passed in

list.title: Vector2#distanceSquared
list.description: Returns the distance squared from this vector to vector passed in

list.title: Vector2#divide
list.description: Returns a copy of this vector divided by the vector passed in

list.title: Vector2#dot
list.description: Returns the dot product of this and the vector passed in

list.title: Vector2#floor
list.description: Returns a copy of this vector with each axis floored

list.title: Vector2#invert
list.description: Returns a copy of this vector that has been inverted

list.title: Vector2#length
list.description: Returns the length of this vector

list.title: Vector2#lengthSquared
list.description: Returns the length of this vector squared

list.title: Vector2#lerp
list.description: Returns a new vector that is p percent between this and the vector passed in

list.title: Vector2#multiply
list.description: Returns a copy of this vector times the vector passed in

list.title: Vector2#normalize
list.description: Returns a new vector in same direction as this one with the length passed in

list.title: Vector2#rotate
list.description: Returns copy of this vector rotated by the angle passed in

list.title: Vector2#scale
list.description: Returns a copy of this vector scaled by the vector passed in

list.title: Vector2#setAngle
list.description: Sets this vector with angle and length passed in

list.title: Vector2#setDirection
list.description: Set the integer direction of this vector, corrosponding to multiples of 90 degree rotation (0-3)

list.title: Vector2#subtract
list.description: Returns a copy of this vector minus the vector passed in

list.title: Vector2#toString
list.description: Returns this vector expressed as a string

list.title: WebGL
list.description:
LittleJS WebGL Interface

  • All webgl used by the engine is wrapped up here
  • For normal stuff you won't need to see or call anything in this file
  • For advanced stuff there are helper functions to create shaders, textures, etc
  • Can be disabled with glEnable to revert to 2D canvas rendering
  • Batches sprite rendering on GPU for incredibly fast performance
  • Sprite transform math is done in the shader where possible
  • Supports shadertoy style post processing shaders

list.title: WebGL.glCanvas
list.description: The WebGL canvas which appears above the main canvas and below the overlay canvas

list.title: WebGL.glCompileShader
list.description: Compile WebGL shader of the given type, will throw errors if in debug mode

list.title: WebGL.glContext
list.description: 2d context for glCanvas

list.title: WebGL.glCopyToContext
list.description: Draw any sprites still in the buffer, copy to main canvas and clear

list.title: WebGL.glCreateProgram
list.description: Create WebGL program with given shaders

list.title: WebGL.glCreateTexture
list.description: Create WebGL texture from an image and init the texture settings

list.title: WebGL.glDraw
list.description: Add a sprite to the gl draw list, used by all gl draw functions

list.title: WebGL.glFlush
list.description: Draw all sprites and clear out the buffer, called automatically by the system whenever necessary

list.title: WebGL.glInitPostProcess
list.description: Set up a post processing shader

list.title: WebGL.glSetTexture
list.description:
Set the WebGl texture, called automatically if using multiple textures

  • This may also flush the gl buffer resulting in more draw calls and worse performance
